intro: Valeriana tuberosa var. eriophylla, commonly known as the slender valerian, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces tuberous roots that are often used in traditional medicine for their sedative properties. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while the flowers are typically pink or white. Valeriana tuberosa var. eriophylla thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
